poem:
Piri Piri Chicken 

In the flame's embrace,  
roots whisper across continents—  
Angola, Mozambique sigh  
in a marinade that spits and sings.

From grill's kiss,  
a fiery dance unfolds;  
local tongues bless its bite—  
flavors held  
in the brisk tang of tradition  
and spice-laden time.  
Chains spread it wide,  
but here,  
heart of the dish beats undaunted.
